messageBody:
Jason,

I'm running 3.5, and running from the main method of the code given
by you below.
In my test method, I call a method setValues(), which calls
Class.forName("className") as it's first line. This then throws a
ClassNotFoundException, as the ClassLoader used by the forName method
is null for some reason.

Can you try to call a similar method from a test method which makes
this call and check the results?


--- In junit@y..., "Jason Rogers" <jason.rogers@t...> wrote:
> We are running 3.5.2...
>
> Are you still trying to run with the JUnit jar? If so, move away
from that.
> Import the source into VAJ in a new project called JUnit, or
whatever suits
> your fancy. Then try the solution I listed below, it ought to
work! If it
> doesn't there is still something different about our environment
settings.
>
> -Jason
>

> > > project_resources subdir does not works as automagically as
I
> > thought
> > > (because I tried to include just its dir and that didn't
work).
> > >
> > > Have you tried the fixClasspath/setClasspath method yet?
> > >
> > > -Jason
> > >
> > >
> > > ********** TEST * CODE **********
> > > //imports
> > >
> > > public class Tester extends TestRunner {
> > > public Tester() {
> > > super();
> > > }
> > > public static void main(String[] args) {
> > > String[] newargs = new String[1];
> > > try{
> > > fixClasspath();
> > > newargs[0] = Class.forName("<a class
> > name>").toString
> > ();
> > > TestRunner.main(newargs);
> > > } catch (Exception ex){
> > > ex.toString();
> > > }
> > > private static void fixClasspath(){
> > > Workspace workspace = ToolEnv.connectToWorkspace
();
> > > Object[] classpath =
> > workspace.getClassPathEntries();
> > > Object[] projects = workspace.getProjects();
> > > Object[] newClasspath = new
> > Object[classpath.length +
> > > projects.length];
> > >
> > > //add the projects to the new classpath
> > > System.arraycopy(projects, 0, newClasspath, 0,
> > projects.length);
> > >
> > > //add the original classpath to the new classpath
> > > System.arraycopy(classpath, 0, newClasspath,
> > projects.length,
> > > classpath.length);
> > >
> > > try {
> > > workspace.setClassPath(newClasspath);
> > > } catch(IvjException e) {
> > > e.printStackTrace();
> > > }
> > > }
> > > }
> > > }
